Thanks. Very nice place.

I had a wonderful stay! The venue was stunning, the space is even larger and more beautiful than it seems in pictures. Esther was an incredible host, she went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and accommodated. I can only hope I get the opportunity to stay here again soon.
Amazing place! Esther was very accommodating and made my daughter and I trip very enjoyable. The home was breathtaking and felt like home. We can’t wait to go back- highly recommended.

Very clean, newly remodeled and plenty of interior space.

The house is conveniently located to interstate 81, since my family is in Wilkes-Barre it made getting back and forth very quick. Pro tip, get some pizza in Old Forge! We will definitely return.

Loved the stay here! Farrar was very helpful, welcoming and quick to respond with any questions and provided immediate points of contact. The house was also taken care of well and had great amenities, rooms were spacious and clean. The kitchen had many useful gadgets for cooking and cleaning supplies as well and bathrooms were well stocked for any necessities. Thanks for the great experience for my snowboard trip at Montage!!
It was a very clean and nice home. Farrar was amazing and very helpful!

Farrar's place was in excellent condition, especially the main bathroom, which looked as though it had been recently renovated. Every surface throughout was immaculately clean. The kitchen was stocked with plenty of dishes but lacked some basic cooking/baking utensils, so if you plan to do any serious baking, you should plan to bring your own. The microwave oven is only 700-watt, so you'll need to add 43% or 71% to the cooking times for a 1000- or 1200-watt oven respectively. The house has a tankless water heater, so you'll effectively never exhaust the supply of hot water. The water tastes pretty bad, so bring your own drinking water. The front door has a 7-digit touch-panel combination lock that was not working due to low batteries when we arrived, but Farrar was very quick to come over and replace them. The location is okay, ~10 minutes from downtown. The house is on a busy road that makes noticeable noise and is one-way, making getting to the house a tad inconvenient.

The house was clean and conveniently located. Three bedrooms and two full baths allowed us to all be accommodated comfortably. I left a cosmetic bag behind and the owner contacted us immediately which allowed us to go back and retrieve it before we left the area. We will definitely come back when in the area!
thanks for the house and a nice stay, road is a bit busy at times but didn't disturb us. :-)

Beds and couches were comfy. Easy to get in. Could use a little more instruction on how to use thermostat, it was cold in there when we arrived. Also a little more info at checkout as to where to put dirty linens/towels/dishes etc. Overall very satisfied. Great location for us as it's super close to our family.
This is the second week I’ve rented this home for work and it’s an excellent property, great location and we are willing to book again! Thank you for everything.
Great space in this adorable town! Close to everything. Beautiful area. Host was accessible and responsive. Thanks for everything!

This rental home is easily accessible to points all over Scranton, including downtown, Marywood University, the University of Scranton, and various other historic and interesting spots. He was there greeting us each time we came home, and would be on the back deck staring inside whenever we were in kitchen. Several times we attempted to pet him, but he would always scamper off when the door was opened.
The interior of the home was clean and well organized. There were plenty of towels, blankets, space to spread out, and comfortable chairs and couches. The thing that impressed us the most on initial inspection was how well-appointed the kitchen and bathrooms were. The bathrooms had dispensers for hand soap, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. The kitchen had a spice rack full of dried herbs and spices, paper towels, dish soap, hand soap, cleaning products, and dishwasher soap. In the basement was a washer and dryer with detergent and dryer sheets. In other homes we’ve rented, many of these things needed to be purchased separately at the grocery store, and we were really pleased to find all we needed here.
The bedrooms were quiet and had blackout window treatments for nice long sleeps. The beds were very comfortable. There was more than ample dresser and closet space for anything you bring with you on vacation.
The complaints we had about our experience were minor, and were greatly outshined by the pluses. The lighting in the home wasn’t great. I found several lightbulbs that weren’t working, and the lamps downstairs were harsh to look at when they were on and really didn’t provide adequate room illumination. There was no welcome packet advertising local restaurants, maps, or other attractions, and no pamphlet describing the rules of the property or the Wi-Fi information. There were no notepads or paper. We also like to write in a guest book and read entries written by prior guests. We didn’t see that either. The bathrooms didn’t have exhaust fans, which I understand isn’t common for these old homes.
All in all we loved our time in Scranton and will definitely return to 903 Richmont on our next trip to NEPA.
